intro: Oreoselinum legitimum, commonly known as the European sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic when crushed. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in coastal and sandy soils. Oreoselinum legitimum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
